intro: Lesquerella nodosa, commonly known as the nodding lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant produces distinctive, elongated seed pods that contain small, brown seeds. Lesquerella nodosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
